marker.ph: Event Listeners
/* logs any collider hits if uncommented. it gets noisy so it is commented out for the demo ... */
/* if holding down bump up our movement amount and turn off one way platform detection for a frame. ... */
Event Listeners
/* logs any collider hits if uncommented. it gets noisy so it is commented out for the demo ... */
/* if holding down bump up our movement amount and turn off one way platform detection for a frame. ... */
/* Update is called once per frame ... */
internal types
events, properties and fields
/// when true, one way platforms will be ignored when moving vertically for a single frame ...
/// defines how far in from the edges of the collider rays are cast from. If cast with a 0 extent it will often r ...
/// mask with all layers that the player should interact with ...
/// mask with all layers that trigger events should fire when intersected ...
/// mask with all layers that should act as one-way platforms. Note that one-way platforms should always be EdgeC ...
/// the max slope angle that the CC2D can climb ...
/// the threshold in the change in vertical movement between frames that constitutes jumping ...
/// curve for multiplying speed based on slope (negative = down slope and positive = up slope) ...
/// this is used to calculate the downward ray that is cast to check for slopes. We use the somewhat arbitrary va ...
/// holder for our raycast origin corners (TR, TL, BR, BL) ...
/// stores our raycast hit during movement ...
/// stores any raycast hits that occur this frame. we have to store them in case we get a hit moving ...
/* we use this flag to mark the case where we are travelling up a slope and we modified our delta.y to allow the ... */
/// attempts to move the character to position + deltaMovement. Any colliders in the way will cause the movement ...
/* first, we check for a slope below us before moving ... */
/// moves directly down until grounded ...
/// this should be called anytime you have to modify the BoxCollider2D at runtime. It will recalculate the distan ...
/* figure out the distance between our rays in both directions ... */
Movement Methods
/// resets the raycastOrigins to the current extents of the box collider inset by the skinWidth. It is inset ...
/// we have to use a bit of trickery in this one. The rays must be cast from a small distance inside of our ...
/* if we are grounded we will include oneWayPlatforms only on the first ray (the bottom one). this will allow us ... */
/* we add a small fudge factor for the float operations here. if our rayDistance is smaller ... */
/// handles adjusting deltaMovement if we are going up a slope. ...
/* we only need to adjust the deltaMovement if we are not jumping ... */
/* we dont set collisions on the sides for this since a slope is not technically a side collision. ... */
/* safety check. we fire a ray in the direction of movement just in case the diagonal we calculated above ends up ... */
/* this is a hack to deal with the top of slopes. if we walk up a slope and reach the apex we can get in a situat ... */
/* we add a small fudge factor for the float operations here. if our rayDistance is smaller ... */
/// checks the center point under the BoxCollider2D for a slope. If it finds one then the deltaMovement is adjust ...
